Sat., Oct. 6: We must raise our voices to demand that police implement policies that make ALL community members safe and free.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

We filed a lawsuit last week against the Exeter Police Department for unlawfully acting as immigrant enforcement officers. We need to ensure that our local communities are safe and welcoming places for all people, including immigrants. This means making sure that local police departments are not questioning people about their immigration status, unlawfully detaining them, and turning them over to ICE.

Join us this Saturday, October 6 to rally in support of immigrants' rights and to keep our communities safe and free! The rally will be at the Exeter Town Hall steps. Please bring signs, family, and friends. We will also have extra signs there.

Exeter Rally for Immigrant Rights

Support our immigrant communities, and help us call upon local police to stop acting as ICE officers. Bring signs, family, and friends!

Saturday, October 6, 1-3 p.m.
Exeter Town Hall
9 Front St.
Exeter, New Hampshire 03833

RSVP TODAY

Many local police departments in NH — including Exeter, Salem, and Danbury — routinely take on the role of immigration enforcement by unlawfully detaining, seizing, and arresting people merely on suspicion that they are in the United States without documentation. Not only are these practices unlawful, they are deeply harmful to public safety as they violate the trust of our communities and deter people from cooperating with law enforcement. Moreover, such practices contradict our "Live Free or Die" principles.

As a community we must raise our voices to demand that local police not only end these practices but that they implement policies that make ALL of their community members safe and free.

Dan Pontoh
Community Organizer, ACLU of New Hampshire
